snippet: The Girl Scouts of the U.S.A. has approved “Digital Cookie,” a platform for scouts to sell and ship Thin Mints, Samoas and others to friends and relatives.
abstract: Girl Scouts of the USA has approved online platform for scouts to sell and ship cookies to friends and relatives around the country; expansion beyond traditional selling strategies is expected to bring nearly $800 million increase in annual cookie sales, and comes after years of prohibiting Internet sales.
lead_paragraph: The Girl Scouts of the U.S.A. has approved “Digital Cookie,” a platform for scouts to sell and ship Thin Mints, Samoas and others to friends and relatives.

headline.main: Online Sales for Girl Scout Cookies Are Approved
headline.print_headline: Girl Scouts Set Sights on the Internet as a Cookie-Sale Ban Is Lifted
